headline.main: GREEN-GOODS MEN PROTECTED; SENATE COMMITTEE HEARS A NEW CHARGE AGAINST THE POLICE. GEORGE APPO GIVES MINUTE DETAILS. Five Per Cent, of the Proceeds, He Says, Are Paid to Prevent Interference. NEW-YORK CITY A RICH FIELD. In No Other City Are the Swindlers Allowed to Work with Such Safety -- Appo Himself Has Been Prevented from Carrying on the Business -- Two Men, He Says, Divide the Territory -- Sensational Testimony at the Morning Session -- Edgar A Whitney, a Parkhurst Society Detective, Says He Paid Money to the Police to Protect a Gambling House -- Once Handed the Envelope to Capt. Killilea for the Ward Man -- Evelyn Bell Declares She Paid $150 Every Three Months -- Miss Harvey Swears She Never Paid a Cent.

docs.abstract: Appo, George; Testimony Regarding Protection of Green-goods Swindlers
